paper.title: Strategies for Integrating Deep Learning Surrogate Models with HPC Simulation Applications
paper.abstract: The emerging trend of the convergence of high performance computing (HPC), machine learning/deep learning (ML/DL), and big data analytics presents a host of challenges for large-scale computing campaigns that seek best practices to interleave traditional scientific simulation-based workloads with ML/DL models. A portfolio of systematic approaches to incorporate deep learning into modeling and simulation serves a vital need when we support AI for science at a computing facility. In this paper, we evaluate several strategies for deploying deep learning surrogate models in a representative physics application on supercomputers at the Oak Ridge Leadership Computing Facility (OLCF). We discuss a set of recommended deployment architectures and implementation approaches. We analyze and evaluate these alternatives and show their performance and scalability up to 1000 GPUs on two mainstream platforms equipped with different deep learning hardware and software stacks.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要讨论的是将深度学习代理模型与高性能计算（HPC）模拟应用相结合的策略，其应用场景是物理学模拟，并未提及任何金融领域的应用。
